title: Cursed ancient artifact conjures up scares in new horror movie, 'Whistle'
description: High school students stumble upon a cursed artifact in the new movie "Whistle," starring Dafne Keen and Sophie Nélisse.

title: How a Comox Valley fossil discovery forever changed paleontology in B.C.
description: The elasmosaur replica at the Courtenay Museum and Paleontology Centre. Photo by Dave Flawse/The Discourse" data-medium-file="https://i0.wp.com/cheknews.ca/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/870e61661fdaabb51f13c309a260cbdf125d920002bc11c236ed1f9e81abdda0-e1770417453668.jpg?fit=300%2C169&quality=89&ssl=1" data-large-file="https://i0.wp.com/cheknews.ca/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/870e61661fdaabb51f13c309a260cbdf125d920002bc11c236ed1f9e81abdda0-e1770417453668.jpg?fit=780%2C440&quality=89&ssl=1" />Mike Trask’s Comox Valley-based discovery would forever change paleontology in B.C. and would inspire a flood of amateur paleontologists, many of whom would go on to make hundreds of new discoveries in the field.The post How a Comox Valley fossil discovery forever changed paleontology in B.C. appeared first on CHEK.

title: A 407-Million-Year-Old Fossil Found On The Shores Of Quebec May Belong To An Unknown And Extinct Branch Of Life - Chip Chick

title: Possible World's First Surgery Discovered: Viking Skull Reveals Ancient Trepanation
description: Archaeologists have uncovered a Viking-age human skull exhibiting evidence of trepanation, potentially the world's first surgical procedure. The remains, dating back to the ninth century, belonged to a tall young man and reveal insights into ancient medical practices and burial rituals.
